block.p: Denise Sondra Dimson, the daughter of Rise and Barry H. Dimson of New York, is to be married this evening to Yoav Rekem, a son of Nehama Rekem of Ramat ha Sharon, Israel, and the late Jacob Rekem. Rabbi Rolando Matalon is to officiate at the St. Regis in New York.

The bride, 29, is a vice president based in New York and the legal counsel at Ecosmart Healthy Properties, a company that advises real estate developers on energy use, air quality and other environmental matters. Her father is the company's president. She graduated from the University of Michigan and the New York University School of Law. Her mother is a co-owner of Dimson Homma, a decorative arts and antiques gallery in New York.

Denise Sondra Dimson, the daughter of Rise and Barry H. Dimson of New York, is to be married this evening to Yoav Rekem, a son of Nehama Rekem of Ramat ha Sharon, Israel, and the late Jacob Rekem. Rabbi Rolando Matalon is to officiate at the St. Regis in New York.

The bride, 29, is a vice president based in New York and the legal counsel at Ecosmart Healthy Properties, a company that advises real estate developers on energy use, air quality and other environmental matters. Her father is the company's president. She graduated from the University of Michigan and the New York University School of Law. Her mother is a co-owner of Dimson Homma, a decorative arts and antiques gallery in New York.
The bride's grandfather the late Irving Dimson was a developer of high-rise apartment buildings in New York.

The bridegroom, 30, received undergraduate and law degrees from Tel Aviv University and is a candidate for an M.B.A. degree at New York University. His mother teaches geography and biblical history at Alliance Junior High School in Tel Aviv. His father was a marketing manager at the Pan El Company, an appliance importer there.
